title: ulaterza658
author: ulaterza658
content: Hello everyone, here is such a question, I use https://top-mining.org/overclocking-msi-afterburner-universal/Overclocking MSI Afterburner MSI Afterburner is a functional utility from MSI, which is designed to overclock NVIDIA and AMD video cards. I realized that this program is for all video cards? I just have amd, or is it better to find it on amd? who can help figure it out?

comments.author: miner29
comments.body: Here is where you get MSI Afterburner….. https://www.msi.com/Landing/afterburner/graphics-cardsYou get it from actually msi not some no name site like you posted.  No idea what you are actually getting from that terrible site you listed but here is the makers site of MSI.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: MSI Afterburner is awesome to overclock cards, both AMD and NvidiaAs user above said, use only official links: https://www.msi.com/Landing/afterburner/graphics-cardsBut there are some points to considerWith Nvidia, MSI Afterburner is probably the only program you need, just to adjust power limit, memory clock, core clock and fans. If you are more experienced you can adjust a curve to set a limit for clock.Talking about AMDs, you can use MSI afterburner too, but with Radeon Settings (come with AMD drivers) you can adjust more and in a easier way, I'll post an image just to you see the adjustsAnd if you want to dig a little more, you can use MorePowerTools to let you reduce voltage (and power consumption) in Radeon SettingsSource of image: https://www.legitreviews.com/amd-radeon-rx-6700-xt-video-card-review_226712/16

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: ulaterza658 on July 25, 2022, 07:58:55 PMHello everyone, here is such a question, I use https://top-mining.org/overclocking-msi-afterburner-universal/Overclocking MSI Afterburner MSI Afterburner is a functional utility from MSI, which is designed to overclock NVIDIA and AMD video cards. I realized that this program is for all video cards? I just have amd, or is it better to find it on amd? who can help figure it out? What video cards do you have?There are some other useful Windows utilities for more advanced overclocking, such as OverdriveNTool. But this utility is not needed for all video cards. For older AMD video cards, a BIOS firmware with modified memory timings is required.
